title: Theodore Roosevelt National Park: Roundup Group Horse Campground
body: Roundup Group Horse Campground       General Information The Roundup Group Horse Camground, located in the park's South Unit, is open from May 1 to October 31 by reservation only. The campground is reserved by one group at a time, so space will not be shared among different parties. Ample parking provides room for several horse trailers and/or RVs (no electric hook-ups). Tenting platforms, raised grills for cooking with wood or charcoal, restrooms, and a covered picnic pavilion are also provided.    Check-in and check-out time is noon.   Maximum group size is 20 people and 20 horses, or 30 people without horses.   Maximum length of stay is 5 nights annually.   Weather dependant, water may/may not be available during May and October   Fees  $40 per night (flat rate regardless of group size)   Reservations Online reservations are now available. To reserve the site, visit recreation.gov or call 1-877-444-6777.    Requested minimum group size is 6, maximum group size is 20 people and 20 horses, or 30 people without horses.   Theodore Roosevelt National Park cannot make reservations.     Regulations, particularly involving grazing, hitching, and weed-free horse feed will be strictly enforced.
